include / skia

SkSystemEventTypes.h

00001 #ifndef SkSystemEventTypes_DEFINED
00002 #define SkSystemEventTypes_DEFINED
00003 
00004 /*
00005         The goal of these strings is two-fold:
00006         1) make funny strings (containing at least one char < 32) to avoid colliding with "user" strings
00007         2) keep them <= 4 bytes, so we can avoid an allocation in SkEvent::setType()
00008 */
00009 #define SK_EventType_Delay              "\xd" "lay"
00010 #define SK_EventType_Inval              "nv" "\xa" "l"
00011 #define SK_EventType_Key                "key" "\x1" 
00012 #define SK_EventType_OnEnd "on" "\xe" "n"
00013 #define SK_EventType_Unichar    "\xc" "har"
00014 #define SK_EventType_KeyUp      "key" "\xf"
00015 
00016 #endif
